labels.analysis: The MCP Server is primarily focused on academic research by providing tools to search, download, and read scholarly papers from multiple reputable sources (arXiv, PubMed, bioRxiv, medRxiv, and Google Scholar). Its core functionality revolves around accessing and processing academic content, making it particularly useful for researchers, students, and anyone involved in scholarly work. The server simplifies the research workflow by allowing users to not just search for papers but also download and extract text content for further analysis.
labels.reasoning: The primary label "Web Search & Research" is chosen because the server's main purpose is to facilitate academic research through web-based search and content retrieval. The secondary label "Memory Management" is included because the server deals with storing and retrieving academic papers, which aligns with data storage and knowledge management. No custom label is needed as the predefined categories adequately cover the server's functionality.

tools.name: search_arxiv
tools.description:
Search academic papers from arXiv.

    Args:
        query: Search query string (e.g., 'machine learning').
        max_results: Maximum number of papers to return (default: 10).
    Returns:
        List of paper metadata in dictionary format.

tools.name: search_pubmed
tools.description:
Search academic papers from PubMed.

    Args:
        query: Search query string (e.g., 'machine learning').
        max_results: Maximum number of papers to return (default: 10).
    Returns:
        List of paper metadata in dictionary format.

tools.name: search_biorxiv
tools.description:
Search academic papers from bioRxiv.

    Args:
        query: Search query string (e.g., 'machine learning').
        max_results: Maximum number of papers to return (default: 10).
    Returns:
        List of paper metadata in dictionary format.

tools.name: search_medrxiv
tools.description:
Search academic papers from medRxiv.

    Args:
        query: Search query string (e.g., 'machine learning').
        max_results: Maximum number of papers to return (default: 10).
    Returns:
        List of paper metadata in dictionary format.

tools.name: search_google_scholar
tools.description:
Search academic papers from Google Scholar.

    Args:
        query: Search query string (e.g., 'machine learning').
        max_results: Maximum number of papers to return (default: 10).
    Returns:
        List of paper metadata in dictionary format.

tools.name: download_arxiv
tools.description:
Download PDF of an arXiv paper.

    Args:
        paper_id: arXiv paper ID (e.g., '2106.12345').
        save_path: Directory to save the PDF (default: './downloads').
    Returns:
        Path to the downloaded PDF file.

tools.name: download_pubmed
tools.description:
Attempt to download PDF of a PubMed paper.

    Args:
        paper_id: PubMed ID (PMID).
        save_path: Directory to save the PDF (default: './downloads').
    Returns:
        str: Message indicating that direct PDF download is not supported.

tools.name: download_biorxiv
tools.description:
Download PDF of a bioRxiv paper.

    Args:
        paper_id: bioRxiv DOI.
        save_path: Directory to save the PDF (default: './downloads').
    Returns:
        Path to the downloaded PDF file.

tools.name: download_medrxiv
tools.description:
Download PDF of a medRxiv paper.

    Args:
        paper_id: medRxiv DOI.
        save_path: Directory to save the PDF (default: './downloads').
    Returns:
        Path to the downloaded PDF file.

tools.name: read_arxiv_paper
tools.description:
Read and extract text content from an arXiv paper PDF.

    Args:
        paper_id: arXiv paper ID (e.g., '2106.12345').
        save_path: Directory where the PDF is/will be saved (default: './downloads').
    Returns:
        str: The extracted text content of the paper.

tools.name: read_pubmed_paper
tools.description:
Read and extract text content from a PubMed paper.

    Args:
        paper_id: PubMed ID (PMID).
        save_path: Directory where the PDF would be saved (unused).
    Returns:
        str: Message indicating that direct paper reading is not supported.

tools.name: read_biorxiv_paper
tools.description:
Read and extract text content from a bioRxiv paper PDF.

    Args:
        paper_id: bioRxiv DOI.
        save_path: Directory where the PDF is/will be saved (default: './downloads').
    Returns:
        str: The extracted text content of the paper.

tools.name: read_medrxiv_paper
tools.description:
Read and extract text content from a medRxiv paper PDF.

    Args:
        paper_id: medRxiv DOI.
        save_path: Directory where the PDF is/will be saved (default: './downloads').
    Returns:
        str: The extracted text content of the paper.

server_info_crawled.name: Paper Search
server_info_crawled.author: @openags/paper-search-mcp
server_info_crawled.overview: Search and download academic papers from multiple sources like arXiv and PubMed. Enhance your research workflow with seamless integration into LLM applications, allowing for efficient access to scholarly content.

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@openags/paper-search-mcp/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
